intro: Iozoste pubescens, commonly known as the hairy iodine plant, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its pubescent (hairy) stems and leaves, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Iozoste pubescens is often found in rocky soils and is adapted to thrive in dry, sunny conditions.
